Description: Mould-made scaraboid in glazed composition; shape of scaraboid undetermined as very damaged back; underside deocrated with schematic figure of a standing man holding a stick in his right hand; motif seems incised rather than stamped (?); pierced lengthwise; glaze lost; pale yellow paste; very worn surface.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The motif depicted on the base appears on some scarabs produced at Naukratis (on the various productions of the “Scarab Factory”, see Webb forthcoming). This scarab belongs to a type which was widely distributed in the Mediterranean area and Southern Russia (Gorton 1996, 93, 98-99, type XXVIII A, subtype A214-219). Petrie illustrated some examples from Naukratis displaying this motif (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVII, 123-125). It can be found on glazed composition and Egyptian blue scarabs and scaraboids: BM 1886,0401.1677; Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 88.869; Sydney, The Nicholson Museum, University of Sydney NM00.128.9. Gorton, A.F. 1996, Egyptian and Egyptianizing scarabs: a typology of steatite, faience, and paste scarabs from Punic and other Mediterranean sites, Oxford. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Webb, V. forthcoming, Faience finds from Naukratis and their implications for the chronology of the site, in R. Thomas (ed.), forthcoming. Naukratis in Context I: The Nile Delta as a Landscape of Connectivity. Proceedings of the First Naukratis Project Workshop held at The British Museum 16th – 17th December 2011.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVII, no. 123) (possibly)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OD.096) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musée du Louvre, Paris
